verses.roman:
uṭhi' dui bhāi tabe dante tṛṇa dhari'
dainya kari' stuti kare karayoḍa kari

synonyms: uṭhi'-standing up; dui—two; bhāi—brothers; tabe—then; dante—in the teeth; tṛṇa—straw; dhari'-holding; dainya kari'-in all humbleness; stuti kare—offer prayers; kara-yoḍa—folded hands; kari'-making.
translation: The two brothers got up, and again taking straw between their teeth, they humbly offered their prayers with folded hands.
